meanings.definition: The state of being insular or isolated.
meanings.sent1: The insularities of the small island made it difficult for outsiders to visit.
meanings.sent2: Living on the remote island, they experienced the insularities of being cut off from the mainland.
meanings.sent3: The insularities of the exclusive club led to members feeling like they were in their own little world.
meanings.sent4: Her insularities were like a protective shield, keeping her emotions hidden from others.
meanings.sent5: The insularities of the fortress made it impervious to outside attacks.

meanings.definition: The quality or condition of being narrow-minded or provincial.
meanings.sent1: His insularities prevented him from accepting new ideas or perspectives.
meanings.sent2: The insularities of the small town made it challenging for newcomers to be accepted.
meanings.sent3: Their insularities about foreign cultures made them hesitant to try new foods.
meanings.sent4: The insularities of the group kept them from exploring beyond their familiar surroundings.
meanings.sent5: Her insularities limited her understanding of the world outside her own community.
